column5: Hey everyone,  Just thought I'd introduce myself.  Moving to Hamilton area in May from BC (by way of a few yrs in Utah) and looking forward to the angling opportunities.  Love to throw (and tie) flies - fished steel/trout/salmon back home and all sorts of trout in Utah.  Hoping to meet a few of you this summer and get out on the water.
I'm not a fly guy, but welcome aboard
Welcome aboard! There are a lot of places around lake O where you can catch trout and salmon on flies for the most part of the year.
we have lots of prime trout creeks in southern Ontario....  You should be able to make yourself feel at home in these parts!
grassy ass for the welcome folks!  Can't wait to hop in the truck this fall and do some explorin!  Maybe loosin' some lips by giving away a few nice ties
Welcome! The Hammer is a prime spot to live if you want a short commutes to catch the species you've named.
I thought someone hit a deer!!  Welcome aboard....
I thought he was going to prison!

welcome to Ontario. Fishing's great - but I bet your horizon will take bit to get used to. I moved here from the appalachians (another great trout place) looooong time ago. Took a while to not having a mountain as a horizon!
The mountains are nice, bu they sure do block the view.
Always room for another fly tier on the forum and in Hamilton, welcome aboard.
Welcome to the forum!  I used to live in Hamilton, if you like trout fishing, the Grand River is where you want to be. There's tones of articles about it in The Canadian Fly Fisher Magazine.
darn!! when it was titled fresh meat i was thinking about something totally different!!
Welcome to the board and Ontario.
Welcome to the board.    Same here !!!
